name: Tech Approach Update — Change Impact Classification
description: Update tech approach writing practice to explicitly flag files requiring significant restructuring versus simple extension, with a note on downstream impact for QA test planning. Originated from Custom Meeting #4 action item.

tasks.title: Scoped requirements for tech approach update
subtasks: Read Custom Meeting #4 transcript and action items to understand the problem
Reviewed 4 existing tech approach docs (custom-meetings, sherlockpdf, task-history, redesign) to understand current format and patterns
Reviewed Andrei's agent definition, Enzo's agent definition, QA test plan skill, project kickoff skill, and code review skill
Defined three-level change impact classification: Extend, Modify, Restructure
Specified QA impact notes requirement for restructured files
Wrote acceptance criteria covering agent definition update, QA skill update, and project kickoff skill update
Determined lightweight pipeline: PM (requirements) -> Andrei (implementation) -> Enzo (review)
Scoped out retroactive updates to past tech approach docs and formal template creation
decisions: Three classification levels (Extend/Modify/Restructure) — minimal overhead, one word per file
QA impact notes only required for Restructure, not for Extend or Modify — keeps it lightweight
No formal tech approach template file — Andrei's flexibility in doc structure is valuable, we just add a required section
Lightweight pipeline: PM -> Arch -> QA review. No design, no FE/BE, no design review needed for a process update
Enzo reviews to confirm the QA integration is useful from a tester's perspective
